info.title: Figshare API
info.description: Figshare API v2 - Full REST API documentation for managing articles, collections, projects and more.

get.description: Returns a list of public articles

parameters.name: X-Cursor
parameters.description: Unique hash used for bypassing the item retrieval limit of 9,000 entities. When using this parameter, please note that the offset parameter will not be available, but the limit parameter will still work as expected.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number. Used for pagination with page_size

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of results included on a page. Used for pagination with page

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results included on a page. Used for pagination with query

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Where to start the listing (the offset of the first result). Used for pagination with limit

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field by which to order. Default varies by endpoint/resource.

parameters.name: institution
parameters.description: only return articles from this institution

parameters.name: published_since
parameters.description: Filter by article publishing date. Will only return articles published after the date. date(ISO 8601) YYYY-MM-DD or date-time(ISO 8601) YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ

parameters.name: modified_since
parameters.description: Filter by article modified date. Will only return articles modified after the date. date(ISO 8601) YYYY-MM-DD or date-time(ISO 8601) YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: only return articles from this group

parameters.name: resource_doi
parameters.description: Deprecated by related materials. Only return articles with this resource_doi

parameters.name: item_type
parameters.description: Only return articles with the respective type. Mapping for item_type is: 1 - Figure, 2 - Media, 3 - Dataset, 5 - Poster, 6 - Journal contribution, 7 - Presentation, 8 - Thesis, 9 - Software, 11 - Online resource, 12 - Preprint, 13 - Book, 14 - Conference contribution, 15 - Chapter, 16 - Peer review, 17 - Educational resource, 18 - Report, 19 - Standard, 20 - Composition, 21 - Funding, 22 - Physical object, 23 - Data management plan, 24 - Workflow, 25 - Monograph, 26 - Performance, 27 - Event, 28 - Service, 29 - Model

parameters.name: doi
parameters.description: only return articles with this doi

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: only return articles with this handle

X-Cursor.description: Unique hash used for bypassing the item retrieval limit of 9,000 entities.

422.description: Unprocessable Entity. Syntax is correct but one of the parameters isn't correctly processed

422.description: Unprocessable Entity. Syntax is correct but one of the parameters isn't correctly processed

400.description: Bad Request. Article ID must be an integer and bigger than 0.

parameters.name: folder_path
parameters.description: Folder path to download. If not provided, all files from the article will be downloaded

get.summary: Public Article Embargo for article version
Public Article Confidentiality for article version
get.description: Confidentiality for article version. The confidentiality feature is now deprecated. This has been replaced by the new extended embargo functionality and all items that used to be confidential have now been migrated to items with a permanent embargo on files. All API endpoints related to this functionality will remain for backwards compatibility, but will now be attached to the new extended embargo workflows.

parameters.description: The number of results included on a page. Used for pagination with page

200.description: OK. An array of articles belonging to the account

post.description: Create a new Article by sending article information

put.description: Update an article by passing full body parameters.

patch.description: Partially update an article by sending only the fields to change.

requestBody.description: Subset of article fields to update

get.description: View a private article embargo details

put.description: Note: setting an article under whole embargo does not imply that the article will be published when the embargo will expire. You must explicitly call the publish endpoint to enable this functionality.

delete.description: Will lift the embargo for the specified article

post.description: Edit article resource data.

- If the whole article is under embargo, it will not be published immediately, but when the embargo expires or is lifted.
- When an article is published, a new public version will be generated. Any further updates to the article will affect the private article data. In order to make these changes publicly visible, an explicit publish operation is needed.
Allows authorized users to unpublish an article.
Reserve DOI for article
Reserve Handle for article

get.description: Download files from a private article preserving the folder structure

parameters.name: folder_path
parameters.description: Folder path to download. If not provided, all files from the article will be downloaded

put.description: Updating an article version by passing body parameters.

patch.description: Partially updating an article version by passing only the fields to change.

requestBody.description: Subset of article version fields to update

put.description: For a given public article version update the article thumbnail by choosing one of the associated files
Associate new authors with the article. This will remove all already associated authors and add these new ones

400.description: Bad Request. Article ID must be an integer and bigger than 0. Author with ID Not Found.

post.description: Associate new authors with the article. This will add new authors to the list of already associated authors

put.description: Associate new categories with the article. This will remove all already associated categories and add these new ones

post.description: Associate new categories with the article. This will add new categories to the list of already associated categories

get.description: View confidentiality settings. The confidentiality feature is now deprecated. This has been replaced by the new extended embargo functionality and all items that used to be confidential have now been migrated to items with a permanent embargo on files. All API endpoints related to this functionality will remain for backwards compatibility, but will now be attached to the new extended embargo workflows.

put.description: Update confidentiality settings. The confidentiality feature is now deprecated. This has been replaced by the new extended embargo functionality and all items that used to be confidential have now been migrated to items with a permanent embargo on files. All API endpoints related to this functionality will remain for backwards compatibility, but will now be attached to the new extended embargo workflows.

delete.description: Delete confidentiality settings. The confidentiality feature is now deprecated. This has been replaced by the new extended embargo functionality and all items that used to be confidential have now been migrated to items with a permanent embargo on files. All API endpoints related to this functionality will remain for backwards compatibility, but will now be attached to the new extended embargo workflows.

The email_verified flag will be set to true once the account is created.

post.description: Create a new project

put.description: Updating an project by passing body parameters.

delete.description:
A project can be deleted only if: - it is not public - it does not have public articles.

When an individual project is deleted, all the articles are moved to my data of each owner.

When a group project is deleted, all the articles and files are deleted as well. Only project owner, group admin and above can delete a project.

patch.description: Partially update a project; only provided fields will be changed.

post.description: Publish a project. Possible after all items inside it are public

get.summary: Get changed articles for Symplectic Elements
get.description: Returns a list of articles for Symplectic Elements integration to synchronize article data.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: ISO 8601 datetime string indicating the start of the search window (format: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS)

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of results to skip for pagination

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return

parameters.name: is_embargoed
parameters.description: Filter by embargo status. When true, only returns articles with EMBARGO_ARTICLE type

200.description: OK. Returns a list of symplectic articles

ETag.description: Hash of the returned articles for caching purposes

400.description: Bad Request - Missing or invalid parameters

401.description: Unauthorized - Missing or invalid OAuth token

pending_quota_request.description: True if a quota request is pending

user_id.description: User id associated with account, useful for example for adding the account as an author to an item

group_id.description: Not applicable to regular users. This field is reserved to institutions/publishers with access to assign to specific groups

x-maxCombinedLength.description: The combined length of first_name and last_name must not exceed 255 characters.

id.description: A unique ID for the AccountRecord

account_id.description: The ID of the account which generated this report.

created_date.description: Date when the AccountReport was requested

download_url.description: The download link for the generated XLSX

group_id.description: The group ID that was used to filter the report, if any.
Not applicable to regular users. This field is reserved to institutions/publishers with access to assign to specific groups

defined_type_name.description: Name of the article type identifier

resource_doi.description: Deprecated by related materials. Not applicable to regular users. In a publisher case, this is the publisher article DOI.

resource_title.description: Deprecated by related materials. Not applicable to regular users. In a publisher case, this is the publisher article title.

download_disabled.description: If true, downloading of files for this article is disabled

files.description: List of up to 10 article files.

folder_structure.description: Mapping of file ids to folder paths, if folders are used

account_id.description: ID of the account owning the article

description.description: The article description. In a publisher case, usually this is the remote article description

is_metadata_record.description: True if article has no files

tags.description: List of tags to be associated with the article. Keywords can be used instead

keywords.description: List of tags to be associated with the article. Tags can be used instead

references.description: List of links to be associated with the article (e.g ["http://link1", "http://link2", "http://link3"])

related_materials.description: List of related materials; supersedes references and resource DOI/title.

categories.description: List of category ids to be associated with the article(e.g [1, 23, 33, 66])

categories_by_source_id.description: List of category source ids to be associated with the article, supersedes the categories property

authors.description: List of authors to be associated with the article. The list can contain the following fields: id, name, first_name, last_name, email, orcid_id. If an id is supplied, it will take priority and everything else will be ignored. For adding more authors use the specific authors endpoint.

custom_fields.description: List of key, values pairs to be associated with the article

custom_fields_list.description: List of custom fields values, supersedes custom_fields parameter

doi.description: Not applicable for regular users. In an institutional case, make sure your group supports setting DOIs. This setting is applied by figshare via opening a ticket through our support/helpdesk system.

handle.description: Not applicable for regular users. In an institutional case, make sure your group supports setting Handles. This setting is applied by figshare via opening a ticket through our support/helpdesk system.

resource_doi.description: Deprecated by related materials. Not applicable to regular users. In a publisher case, this is the publisher article DOI.

resource_title.description: Deprecated by related materials. Not applicable to regular users. In a publisher case, this is the publisher article title.

group_id.description: Not applicable to regular users. This field is reserved to institutions/publishers with access to assign to specific groups

embargo_options.description: List of embargo permissions that are associated with the article. If the type is logged_in and the group_ids list is empty, then the whole institution can see the article; if there are multiple group_ids, then only users that are under those groups can see the article.

embargo_date.description: Date when the embargo expires and the article gets published, '0' value will set up permanent embargo

embargo_type.description: Embargo can be enabled at the article or the file level. Possible values: article, file

embargo_options.description: List of embargo permissions to be associated with the article. The list must contain `id` and can also contain `group_ids`(a field that only applies to 'logged_in' permissions). The new list replaces old options in the database, and an empty list removes all permissions for this article. Administration permission has to be set up alone but logged in and IP range permissions can be set up together.

description.description: The article description. In a publisher case, usually this is the remote article description

tags.description: List of tags to be associated with the article. Keywords can be used instead

keywords.description: List of tags to be associated with the article. Tags can be used instead

references.description: List of links to be associated with the article (e.g ["http://link1", "http://link2", "http://link3"])

related_materials.description: List of related materials; supersedes references and resource DOI/title.

categories.description: List of category ids to be associated with the article(e.g [1, 23, 33, 66])

categories_by_source_id.description: List of category source ids to be associated with the article, supersedes the categories property

authors.description: List of authors to be associated with the article. The list can contain the following fields: id, name, first_name, last_name, email, orcid_id. If an id is supplied, it will take priority and everything else will be ignored. For adding more authors use the specific authors endpoint.

custom_fields.description: List of key, values pairs to be associated with the article

doi.description: Not applicable for regular users. In an institutional case, make sure your group supports setting DOIs. This setting is applied by figshare via opening a ticket through our support/helpdesk system.

handle.description: Not applicable for regular users. In an institutional case, make sure your group supports setting Handles. This setting is applied by figshare via opening a ticket through our support/helpdesk system.

resource_doi.description: Deprecated by related materials. Not applicable to regular users. In a publisher case, this is the publisher article DOI.

resource_title.description: Deprecated by related materials. Not applicable to regular users. In a publisher case, this is the publisher article title.

resource_doi.description: Only return articles with this resource_doi

item_type.description: Only return articles with the respective type. Mapping for item_type is: 1 - Figure, 2 - Media, 3 - Dataset, 5 - Poster, 6 - Journal contribution, 7 - Presentation, 8 - Thesis, 9 - Software, 11 - Online resource, 12 - Preprint, 13 - Book, 14 - Conference contribution, 15 - Chapter, 16 - Peer review, 17 - Educational resource, 18 - Report, 19 - Standard, 20 - Composition, 21 - Funding, 22 - Physical object, 23 - Data management plan, 24 - Workflow, 25 - Monograph, 26 - Performance, 27 - Event, 28 - Service, 29 - Model

handle.description: Only return articles with this handle

project_id.description: Only return articles in this project

page.description: Page number. Used for pagination with page_size

page_size.description: The number of results included on a page. Used for pagination with page

limit.description: Number of results included on a page. Used for pagination with query

offset.description: Where to start the listing (the offset of the first result). Used for pagination with limit

institution.description: only return collections from this institution

published_since.description: Filter by article publishing date. Will only return articles published after the date. date(ISO 8601) YYYY-MM-DD or date-time(ISO 8601) YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ

modified_since.description: Filter by article modified date. Will only return articles modified after the date. date(ISO 8601) YYYY-MM-DD or date-time(ISO 8601) YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ

group.description: only return collections from this group

group_id.description: The group in which the article is present.

account_id.description: The ID of the account of the owner of the article of this review.

assigned_to.description: The ID of the account to which this review is assigned.

article_id.description: The ID of the article of this review.

version.description: The Version number of the article in review.

comments_count.description: The number of comments in the review.

created_date.description: The creation date of the review.

modified_date.description: The date the review has been modified.

request_number.description: The request number of the review.

resolution_comment.description: The resolution comment of the review.

account_id.description: The ID of the account which generated this comment.

type.description: The ID of the account which generated this comment.

created_date.description: The creation date of the comment.

modified_date.description: The date the comment has been modified.

value.description: Custom metadata value (can be either a string or an array of strings)

is_mandatory.description: Whether the field is mandatory or not

value.description: Custom metadata value (can be either a string or an array of strings)

code.description: A machine friendly error code, used by the dev team to identify the error.

message.description: A human friendly message explaining the error.

link.description: Url for an existing file that will not be uploaded to Figshare

md5.description: MD5 sum pre-computed on client side.

name.description: File name including the extension; can be omitted only for linked files.

size.description: File size in bytes; can be omitted only for linked files.

folder_path.description: Unix-style directory path of the file; only available if the file was uploaded within a folder structure

id.description: A funding ID as returned by the Funding Search endpoint

title.description: The title of the new user created funding

is_user_defined.description: Return 1 whether the grant has been introduced manually, 0 otherwise

association_criteria.description: HR code associated with group, if code exists

ip_name.description: IP range name; value appears if type is ip_range

page.description: Page number. Used for pagination with page_size

page_size.description: The number of results included on a page. Used for pagination with page

limit.description: Number of results included on a page. Used for pagination with query

offset.description: Where to start the listing (the offset of the first result). Used for pagination with limit

id.description: The ID of the item type.

name.description: The name of the item type

string_id.description: The string identifier of the item type.

icon.description: The string identifying the icon of the item type.

public_description.description: The description of the item type.
public_description.example: This is the description of an item type

url_name.description: The URL name of the item type.

refresh_token.description: The refresh token (only provided for certain grant types)

scope.description: The scope of the access token

resource_id.description: only return collections with this resource_id

page_size.description: The number of results included on a page. Used for pagination with page

limit.description: Number of results included on a page. Used for pagination with query

offset.description: Where to start the listing (the offset of the first result). Used for pagination with limit

institution_id.description: Return only authors associated to this institution

group_id.description: Return only authors in this group or subgroups of the group

is_active.description: Return only active authors if True

is_public.description: Return only authors that have published items if True

resource_id.description: only return collections with this resource_id

is_attached_to_public_version.description: True if the file is attached to a public item version

is_active.description: True if private link is active

expires_date.description: Date when this private link should expire - optional. By default private links expire in 365 days.

files.description: List of up to 10 article files.

account_id.description: ID of the account owning the article

download_disabled.description: If true, downloading of files for this article is disabled

fields_of_interest_by_source_id.description: User fields of interest (category source IDs), supersedes the fields_of_interest property

personal_profiles.description: Add up to 10 additional personal profile links

label.description: Label for the personal profile link

url.description: URL for the personal profile link

modified_date.description: Date when project was last modified

citation.example:
lilliput, figshare admin (2017): first project item. figshare.
 
 Retrieved: 14 01, May 22, 2017 (GMT)

tags.description: List of article tags. Keywords can be used instead

keywords.description: List of article keywords. Tags can be used instead

is_metadata_record.description: True if article has no files

has_linked_file.description: True if any files are linked to the article

categories.description: List of categories selected for the article

related_materials.description: List of related materials; supersedes references and resource DOI/title.

role_name.description: Role of the the collaborator inside the project

comment.description: Text sent when inviting the user to the project

modified_date.description: Date when project was last modified
Date when project was last modified

account_id.description: ID of the account owning the project

title.description: The title for this project - mandatory. 3 - 1000 characters.

funding.description: Grant number or organization(s) that funded this project. Up to 2000 characters permitted.

group_id.description: Only if project type is group.

custom_fields.description: List of key, values pairs to be associated with the project

custom_fields_list.description: List of custom fields values, supersedes custom_fields parameter

user_name.description: Username of the one who wrote the note

modified_date.description: Date when note was last modified

order.description: The field by which to order.

title.description: The title for this project - mandatory. 3 - 1000 characters.

funding.description: Grant number or organization(s) that funded this project. Up to 2000 characters permitted.

custom_fields.description: List of key, values pairs to be associated with the project

custom_fields_list.description: List of custom fields values, supersedes custom_fields parameter

is_link_only.description: True if file is hosted somewhere else

mimetype.description: MIME Type of the file, it defaults to an empty string

id.description: The ID of the related material; can be used to add existing materials of the same account to items.

identifier.description: The related material identifier (e.g., DOI, Handle, ISBN). Mandatory if creating a new material.

title.example: Rooter: A Methodology for the Typical Unification of Access Points and Redundancy

relation.description: The relation between the item and the related material; defaults to 'References'. Mandatory if creating a new material.

identifier_type.description: The type of the identifier of the related material; defaults to 'URL'. Mandatory if creating a new material.

is_linkout.description: Flag for highlighting this related material in the call-out box

link.description: The full hyperlink for the identifier. Automatically generated by Figshare.

quota.description: Total storage available to account, in bytes

used_quota.description: Storage used by the account, in bytes

user_id.description: User id associated with account, useful for example for adding the account as an author to an item

order.description: Order of the field in the group

is_mandatory.description: Whether the field is mandatory or not

publisherAcceptance.description: Date when the item was accepted for publication

startOffset.description: Indexes on byte range. zero-based and inclusive

endOffset.description: Indexes on byte range. zero-based and inclusive

locked.description: When a part is being uploaded it is being locked, by setting the locked flag to true. No changes/uploads can happen on this part from other requests.

token.description: token received after initializing a file upload

name.description: name of file on upload server

url_name.description: Name that appears in website url
